data.title: Sister Act
data.meta_description: Sister Act - October 2017 Directed by Brad Rondeau
data.text:
Sister Act - October 2017

Directed by Brad Rondeau

A musical based on the motion picture (1992).

Featuring original music by Tony- and eight-time Oscar winner, Alan Menken (Newsies, Beauty and the Beast, Little Shop of Horrors), this uplifting divine musical was nominated for five Tony Awards, including Best Musical.

When glitzy diva, Deloris Van Cartier witnesses a murder, she is forced to hide out until she can be a witness at his trial. The Mother Superior at the local convent agrees, reluctantly, to take her in temporarily. Disguised as a nun, she finds herself at odds with both the rigid lifestyle and uptight Mother Superior. Using her unique disco moves and singing talent to inspire the choir, Deloris breathes new life into the church and community but, in doing so, blows her cover. Soon, the gang is giving chase, only to find them up against Deloris and the power of her newly found sisterhood. This performance is full of fun for the whole family from opening to final bows.

Sister Act is directed by Brad Rondeau, music director, Beth Wondolowski, assistant director Sarah Robson. Sister Act features a cast of talented actors lead by Kelly Falls (Deloris), including Lynn Wilde Concannon (Mother Superior), Rich Staton (Curtis), Gary Thames (Eddie), and a chorus of quirky nuns from all around the Livingston County area.

​

Show dates:

Friday, Oct. 13, Saturday, Oct. 14 AND Oct 21, 2017 @ 7:30 p.m.

Sunday, Oct. 22, 2017 @ 2:00 p.m.

Tickets go on sale to the general public on Monday, August 21, 2017. Tickets are $16.00 for adults and $14.00 for Students/Seniors 60+. Reserved seating available online HERE (for an additional $1.50 convenience/processing fee) or at our distributors, Busch’s Fresh Market in Pinckney and the Brighton Tux Shop. For additional information, you can call the NEW Pinckney Players hotline, 810.206.5911 anytime. ​Live box office Friday's from noon-3pm
